# dragInteraction(_:sessionIsRestrictedToDraggingApplication:)

**Instance Method**

Asks the delegate whether the system should restrict the drag session to the app that started the session.

## Declaration

```swift
@MainActor optional func dragInteraction(_ interaction: UIDragInteraction, sessionIsRestrictedToDraggingApplication session: any UIDragSession) -> Bool
```

## Parameters

- **interaction**: The interaction that called this method.
- **session**: The drag session to restrict or not restrict.

## Return Value

[doc://com.apple.documentation/documentation/Swift/true] if you want to restrict the drag session to the app that started it; otherwise [doc://com.apple.documentation/documentation/Swift/false], which is the default if you don’t provide this method.

## Discussion

If you return [doc://com.apple.documentation/documentation/Swift/true] and the user attempts to drop the drag items onto another app, the system cancels the session.



## Restricting the drag behavior

- **dragInteraction(_:sessionAllowsMoveOperation:)**: Asks the delegate whether the session allows the move operation.
